TopicTitle: Good news? Recent KSP2 job postings: Community Manager positions...

Articles.Content:
Looks like Take Two has posted up some new KSP2 jobs recently! 2X "Assistant Community Manager" positions, and 1X "Senior Community Manager."

Assistant listings:

https://careers.take2games.com/job/3620077

https://careers.take2games.com/job/3615900

Manager listing:

https://careers.take2games.com/job/3615898

Highlights:

Listings mention growing the brand "into new initiatives beyond gaming."

They will "represent the KSP brand and spirit as on-site representatives at trade and consumer shows." One of the assistant community manager listings adds: "(Like PAX shows)"

Listings say: "You're going to play KSP, a lot!"

 

I notice that the listings mention "KSP" a lot, but not "KSP2." I'm guessing they are referring to KSP2, however, since there would be little reason to hire a team to advertise an older game on its way out.

What do those knowledgeable about game development and marketing think about this? Does this inform on how far out we are from release? It looks like there is a "PAX East" in March of 2022. Maybe KSP2 will be there?

Regardless of what this means for the release date, I would personally rather them release it in December of 2022 or even later, than to get another No Man's Sky that would need patching for years later instead of getting regular DLC's.

And NMS holds the trophy for the best redemption arc in gaming history, and is already way beyond what was advertised before initial release. And that's still for free, made by Indie studio!  One could expect bases, vehicles, freighters being sold as dlc (hello, Elite Dangerous!) but no.

That said, I don't think that should happen to KSP, and I don't think it will, as they already kept pushing the release more and more so they can deliver.

About the job posting, I believe KSP here means the franchise as a whole, not particular game. Sure the marketing will soon switch towards the sequel, but there is, and will be, still a lot of people who keep playing the first game. They deserve a post or two once in a while.
When they say KSP, I believe they just mean the entire brand. Also, I think that T2 probably wants people to think about KSP 2 when they think about KSP as brand.
